description: Oregon, Hawaii, South Carolina and have reported more cases in the past week than in any other seven-day period. Weekly deaths in Florida are at record highs.
title: Today's U.S. Covid Numbers: Cases, Hospitalizations, Deaths and Vaccines
title_page: Today's U.S. Covid Numbers: Cases, Hospitalizations, Deaths and Vaccines - The New York Times
maintext:
Over the past week, an average of roughly 163,600 coronavirus cases has been reported each day in the United States, an increase of 12 percent from two weeks ago. Total cases are likely to surpass 40 million within days.
Oregon, Kentucky and Guam have reported more coronavirus cases in the past week than in any other seven-day period. Florida has reported more coronavirus deaths in the past week than in any other seven-day period.
More than 101,500 coronavirus patients are hospitalized nationwide, including more than 15,500 in Florida, which has a far higher hospitalization rate than any other state.
Kentucky is also near its worst point ever, having reached an all-time high in its daily case average on Monday.
